# Pull Request

## Description
Brief description of the changes made in this PR.

## Type of Change
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes)
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test additions/updates
- [ ] CI/CD changes
- [ ] Other (please describe):

## Related Issues
Fixes # (issue number)
Closes # (issue number)

## Testing
### Manual Testing
- [ ] Tested on Windows
- [ ] Tested on macOS
- [ ] Tested on Linux
- [ ] Tested with VS Code versions: [versions]

### Automated Testing
- [ ] Unit tests pass
- [ ] Integration tests pass
- [ ] UI snapshot tests pass
- [ ] No new linting errors

## Screenshots (if applicable)
Before/after screenshots for UI changes.

## Checklist
- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

## Philosophy Alignment
How do these changes align with Tridishti's threefold vision?

### Jnana (Knowledge)
- [ ] Improves knowledge capture/storage/retrieval
- [ ] Enhances learning capabilities
- [ ] Better context awareness

### Karma (Action)
- [ ] Improves workflow tracking
- [ ] Better milestone management
- [ ] Enhanced productivity features

### Bhakti (Reflection)
- [ ] Improves self-reflection capabilities
- [ ] Better feedback mechanisms
- [ ] Enhanced mindfulness features
